author: garyrong
content: <@!425572898787426305> Question again(ðŸ˜‚ sorry). Regarding the transition trigger, now the first `NewHead` event is regarded as the trigger for `PoW` -> `Transition`. However when the first `NewBlock` event received, the local chain needs to verify the block with new rules since it's the first PoS block. Can we use the first `NewBlock` event as the trigger in the implementation wise?

author: m.kalinin
content:
Even if the block has been executed successfully we can't be sure that it's been processed successfully by consensus layer as there are other checks than executing the payload. While `NewHead` could be sent only if a block has been processed successfully from all points of view.

What if an updated client code would listen and accept `NewHead` from the very beginning upon deployment? Wouldn't it be easier to get implemented?

author: garyrong
content: but the spec says `NewBlock message block is built on top of current head of the chain. The block becomes a new head if itâ€™s been processed and considered as valid.`

author: garyrong
content: So, `NewBlock` doesn't mean the block will be the chain head?

author: m.kalinin
content: Depending on implementation in some cases the "valid block" information might not be enough to make a decision about the head. Let me remove this statement from the spec

author: garyrong
content: OK. So it's two steps procedure. (1) execute the block and persist if valid (2) switch head
